body_html:
@ebrevdo I have redesigned and tested with the Linux CPU build, it seems to work now.

On specifics of implementation:

this leads to an error:

name, "".join(traceback.format_list(tb))))
ValueError: Variable root/rnn/gru_cell/gates/weights already exists, disallowed. Did you mean to set reuse=True in VarScope? Originally defined at:

due to a change i recently pushed. this is because you're using the "rnn" scope twice. what you should do is:

with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)

scope.set_reuse()
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
...
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)

I did the following instead:

with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
  tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)

with tf.variable_scope("decoder") as scope:
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
  ...
  scope.reuse_variables()
  ...
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
body_text:
@ebrevdo I have redesigned and tested with the Linux CPU build, it seems to work now.
On specifics of implementation:

this leads to an error:
name, "".join(traceback.format_list(tb))))
ValueError: Variable root/rnn/gru_cell/gates/weights already exists, disallowed. Did you mean to set reuse=True in VarScope? Originally defined at:
due to a change i recently pushed. this is because you're using the "rnn" scope twice. what you should do is:
with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)
scope.set_reuse()
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
...
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)

I did the following instead:
with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
  tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)

with tf.variable_scope("decoder") as scope:
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
  ...
  scope.reuse_variables()
  ...
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
body:
@ebrevdo I have redesigned and tested with the Linux CPU build, it seems to work now.

On specifics of implementation:

>this leads to an error:
>
>name, "".join(traceback.format_list(tb))))
ValueError: Variable root/rnn/gru_cell/gates/weights already exists, disallowed. Did you mean to set reuse=True in VarScope? Originally defined at:
>
>due to a change i recently pushed. this is because you're using the "rnn" scope twice. what you should do is:
>
>with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)
>
>scope.set_reuse()
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
...
... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)

I did the following instead:

```
with tf.variable_scope("rnn") as scope:
  tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(..., scope=scope)

with tf.variable_scope("decoder") as scope:
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
  ...
  scope.reuse_variables()
  ...
  ... = tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder(..., scope=scope)
```
